list_definition.definition: a barrier put up to block a street etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The police used barricades to keep back the crowds.

list_definition.definition: to block something (eg a street) with a barricade

list_ex_of_english: Schoolboys helped to man the barricades, and even the women fought.
Was there really none or virtually none on the troops' side behind the barricades, to see what was going on there?
The soldiers had their arms taken away and their vehicles were commandeered and used to build barricades.
The response should certainly not be to dig in and build more barricades.
Talks should certainly continue, to cement the improved relationship and prevent a return to the political barricades.
The practice of barricading the streets is well under way.
Just in removing the barricades, 4,000 tons of debris and 200 vehicles, many of them buses, were removed.
The barricades have gone up with a vengeance.
